content.description: Start matching on a jug all the way to the left. Move left towards the slab on jugs. Move right on the slab, reach over the roof to find crimps, helpful under-cling towards the right side of the roof. Climb up the vertical face all the way to the right using crimps and really good feet. Top-out.
content.location: Three boulder linkup to the right of the overhang.

content.description: Crux is the start. Rock below overhang is off. Start with right hand on side-pull and left on decent crimp/shallow pocket. Right foot way out right, left foot high on good foot hold lined up in-between the hand holds. Power up to left hand pocket/jug or use the arete. Move to jugs up top and follow the top-out as for the traverse.

Start matching on nice ledge out left. Work your way left through jugs along the crest of the overhang. Once you reach the arete, find small crimps up and left and a good left foot to awkwardly top-out over arete and onto slab. Crux is the top-out.
Shady boulder really nice little area with a few other possibilities. Route starts with a seated start and both hands on a slopper. Moving up to a right grip then start traversing left.
